revised_title: Fossil Plant Organization in Coal Measures: Part XVI
tldr: The author examines the organization and development of fossil plants in the coal measures, focusing on the vascular bundles and medullary axis of Carboniferous Lycopodiacae. They describe new species of Lepidodendron and discuss the differences in cellular medulla development compared to Dicotyledonous Exogens. The study provides insights into the growth patterns and evolution of these ancient plants.
